title: Understanding the Gibbs Free Energy
text: Before solving, recall the Gibbs free energy formula: ΔG° $$=$$ ΔH° - T ΔS° where T is the temperature in Kelvin, ΔH° is the change in enthalpy, and ΔS° is the change in entropy.

title: Calculate Gibbs Free Energy for White Phosphorus
text: Use the formula ΔG°_{white} $$=$$ ΔH°_f_{(white)} - T × S°_{(white)} to find the Gibbs free energy of white phosphorus.

title: Calculation for White Phosphorus
text: Calculate using the given values for white phosphorus: ΔG°_{white} $$=$$ $$0$$ - (298 × 23.30/1000) (convert S° to $$\frac{kJ}{mol·K}$$ by dividing by 1000).

title: Calculate Gibbs Free Energy for Red Phosphorus
text: Now, calculate ΔG°_{red} $$=$$ ΔH°_f_{(red)} - T × S°_{(red)} to determine the Gibbs free energy of red phosphorus.

title: Calculation for Red Phosphorus
text: Find the Gibbs free energy using the values for red phosphorus: ΔG°_{red} $$=$$ $$-17.60$$ - (298 × 22.75/1000) .

title: Comparing Gibbs Free Energies
text: Compare the ΔG° values calculated for both allotropes. The more negative the ΔG°, the more stable the allotrope at $$298$$ K.
